intro: Senecio elbrusensis, commonly known as the Elbrus groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Caucasus Mountains. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters. Senecio elbrusensis is adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in the ecological balance of its mountainous habitat.
